section.title: Mobicents Diameter Sh (Client)
section.para: The Sh interface is the reference for interactions between the following servers:

listitem.para: Home Subscriber Server (HSS) and the SIP Application Server (AS)
HSS and the Open Service Access (OSA) Service Capability Server (SCS) in the IP Multimedia Subsystem (IMS)

section.para: The standard interface is described in the 3GPP Specifications TS29.328 and TS29.329.

For the purposes of this user guide, the following information relates to HSS and AS interactions, and only within the parameters of client-mode. Sh (Client) provides a number of message commands that can be used within the application.

As can be seen from the Command Names, these are related to managing User Data in the HSS. UDR/UDA is used in order to request data from the User profile. Client (AS) sends the request indicating which data he wants (see below for possible kinds of data) and if it has permissions on the HSS, they will be received via UDA.

PUR is meant to be used to update the profile of the user, and the success (or not) of the action is reported back in PUA. SNR offers the possibility to request for changes made in the user profile. If SNR is successful a SNA will be received stating that the operation was successful and when there are profile changes, a PNR will be sent by the HSS to the AS (this is the only time HSS initiates conversation) and the AS should acknowledge with a PNA.

section.title: Resource Adapter Type
section.para: The resource adapter provides the following types:

formalpara.title: Activities
formalpara.para: The following activities are available, with the API definition listed for reference. The API defines methods to easily create and send answers and requests for a certain activity, in addition to retrieving session-specific data.

section.para: The lifecycle of an activity depends on the type of received request and the application interaction. In the case of a subscription activity, the activity timeout is taken into consideration because the subscription may be time-based.
The activitites allows the Sh (Client) application to retrieve message and AVP factories bound to the current session. The functionality offered is limited only by the implementation used.

listitem.para: This is base activity for Sh client side. It is created for event based interaction - like user data requests or profile update requests. Client activity ends when answer is consumed by SLEE.

formalpara.title: Message Factory
formalpara.para: The Message Factory creates events that can be executed within the JAIN SLEE Server. Depending on the situation, Message Factory completes some AVPs for the session using the information made available to it.

section.para: The API for the DiameterMessageFactory is more than 300 lines, and therefore can not be included directly for reference. To view the API, refer to ShClientMessageFactory.java in the source code.

section.title: Configuration
section.para: To configure the examples, changest must be made to the example.properties file in the /du/main/resources directory.
Aside common properties to configure ip, port and realm example has two properties to control which scenario is enabled.

listitem.para: send.udr - boolean type, if set to true, example will send UDR to remote peer.
send.snr - boolean type, if set to true example will send SNR and await updates on profile changes.

example.title: Setting origin and destination properties
example.programlisting:
# ## # Diameter Sh Client Example # ## #
# Controls how example acts on start, it can either send UDR or SNR send.udr = true send.snr = false
# The AS IP Address, Port and Realm (default: 127.0.0.1 / 1812 / mobicents.org) origin.ip=127.0.0.1 origin.port=1812 origin.realm=mobicents.org
# The Remote IP Address, Port and Realm (default: 127.0.0.1 / 3868 / mobicents.org) destination.ip=127.0.0.1 destination.port=3868 destination.realm=mobicents.org
